turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Jesus, Pop, how can you stand the cold, dressed like that? Where's Ma?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Sleeping.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You remember Margie Fogg?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: From Wickham's. Been a while. Like some coffee?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: How you and Ma doing? Haven't seen you in town for a while.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: We're alright. Your Ma's sleeping. You want me to get her?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Where's Ma?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: She's coming.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: I checked on her. She had the electric heater. Cold don't bother her as much as me. Which is why I give her the heater.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Is there something wrong with the phone?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: In the living room.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Why didn't you call and have the furnace fixed?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Wade. I thought she was alright. Till this morning she was.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Listen, it's no big deal, Pop.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Come on, smart guy. Tell how it's no big deal. Tell me how a single one of you is worth a single hair on that woman's head.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Pop, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: You think you can take me now? Come on, try.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: You! By Christ, you -- I know you.  Yeah, you goddamn sonofabitch, I know you. You're a goddamn fucking piece of my heart!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You don't know me. You don't know me!  So fuck you. Fuck you.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Nah-nah-naw! You done done finally done it! Like a man done it. Done it right. I love you, you mean sonofabitch!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Love! What the fuck do you know about love?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Love! I'm made of love!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Call it what you want.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Everything you know is from me.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Bang!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You and me.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Where the Christ you going? You sonofabitch, you leave my fucking truck where it is! I need... Give me the Goddamn keys! I need to get me to town!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Crawl!

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Nothing in the fucking house to drink. Not a fucking thing. My house, my money, my truck -- stolen!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I don't know you. My goddamn father and I don't know you.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Rolfe.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Wade?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah, brother, look, I was calling cause -- has there been anything on TV in Boston about a hunting accident with a guy named Twombley, Evan Twombley?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: There was something. It happened up your way.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah, I know him -- the kid that was with him. Maybe you do too. Jack Hewitt. He works for LaRiviere with me. He's my best friend.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Wade, it's late. I know you're probably at Toby's, but I'm in bed reading. We got different habits.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No, not tonight. I'm in bed too. I'm calling because I need you to listen. You're supposed to be a smart guy. You're a professor. I got this theory. Jack says he didn't see Twombley shot but he did.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: It'll come out Jack lied and the kid'll get hung for it.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: He was scheduled to testify for a committee investigating organized crime in New England and the construction business.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Twombley.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: You think Jack shot him?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well, it was an accident.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: They were out deer hunting, right? Jack probably heard the gun go off, then came back and found the body.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Lillian was here. In Lawford.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: The night before the shooting.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: How was she?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Picked up Jill. She was supposed to visit for the weekend for Halloween. She wanted to go home.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Jill. I was thinking of getting a lawyer. Maybe you can help me.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: A divorce lawyer. A custody lawyer. You know, 'cause of Jill.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Don't think about it. You're exhausted.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah, I guess.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Get some sleep.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I get to feeling like a whipped dog some days, Rolfe, and some night I'm going to bite back. I swear it.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Haven't you already done a bit of that?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No, no, I haven't. Not really. I've growled a little, but I haven't bit.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Pointless to stand around in church with nothing to do, I guess.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: What about Jill? Is Lillian bringing her?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Anyone else want one? Rolfe?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: No thanks. I don't drink.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah. I forgot.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: What about Margie?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Well, do you still plan to get married?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah. She'll probably quit her job and stay out here with Pop. We can't leave him alone here, he'll set the damn place on fire. With Jill here a lot, it'll be good to have Margie around. Things are going to change in that department, by the way. I got a custody lawyer in Concord. I'm gonna see him tomorrow. All hell's gonna break loose, but it's worth it.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I want to let the gas run out. I don't want the bastard driving drunk, and he's always drunk now. After, we'll hide the keys.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Anything new about the shooting? Twombley?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I guess it was an accident, like everybody thinks.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Want to know what I think happened?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Find them everywhere.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: I think your first response to the Twombley shooting was the correct one.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Which is?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: That it wasn't an accident.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Then who shot him?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Well, your friend, I think. Jack Hewitt.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Motive. You gotta have a motive.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Money.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Who'd pay him that kind of money? Not the mob. They got their own guys. Specialists.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: They wouldn't deal with a guy like Jack. Who else benefits if Twombley is suddenly dead?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I don't know. You tell me.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Okay. It's likely there are people in the union who don't want Twombley to testify. They probably include his son-in-law who's vice-president and will probably be the next president. I read that in the papers. What's his name, Mel Gordon?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah, the guy with the BMW I told you about. I did, didn't I?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Here's my theory. Twombley, unaware of illegal union loans or whatever, starts nosing around cause of the investigation and finds out. Finds out his son-in-law is involved.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: So Mel Gordon wouldn't want a professional hit. That'd make the feds dig deeper. He wants an accident.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: A hunting accident is perfect.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Shit, around here, you shoot somebody in the woods, you say it was an accident, you get fined fifty bucks and your hunting license lifted. Jack's probably saying the guy shot himself cause he ain't got his deer yet and don't want his license pulled.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: It's too neat. Things ain't that neat. It makes me mad. That somebody can pay to kill somebody, his own father-in-law, and not be punished for it. Don't that piss you off?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Not particularly.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Right's right, goddamnit! Don't you care what's right?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: I care about what happened. The truth. I'm a student of history, remember?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: I was thinking about that story you told me, about Pop and chopping the firewood out of the ice and after.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: I hate to disappoint you, but I don't think it happened.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Of course it happened. Why would I lie about it?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: It may have happened, but not the way you said.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You think I wouldn't remember a thing like that?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: It wasn't me. I wasn't there, but I heard about it. When I heard about it, it was about Elbourne.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: We'd have to go digging in Vietnam to ask him.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: And Elbourne and Mom took you to the doctor and told him you fell from the hay loft.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well, I never heard that one.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: I remember clearly cause when I heard I became real careful around Pop. I was a careful child and I became a careful adult, but at least I wasn't afflicted by that man's violence.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: That's what you think.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Then you accidentally see your body, or your face, or whatever, and you don't know who the hell it belongs to. Strange. It's the business with the old man, I know, and how incredibly pissed I was at him, and also chasing Jack Hewitt like that, and the Goddamned truck going through the ice, not to mention Margie's being so upset -- one thing on top of another.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Wade, are you alright?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: But you gotta hear this. You won't believe it. Mel Gordon had come by to visit LaRiviere and so now I'm in his office.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I know what it means. I'm just running out of ways to use it.

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: To help, Jack, of course -- and to nail those sonsofbitches, the Two Gordons. That's what Alma calls them. Jesus, Rolfe, whose side are you on?

turns.speaker: ROLFE
turns.text: Take care of the little things first, the things that are distracting you from taking care of the big things. Call Chub Merritt, get your car back, call a dentist, for God's sake, and get your tooth pulled, don't trust the locals, get your facts straight and go straight to the state police. Let them work on this.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It's not like he hasn't made us wait a few times.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, you aren't the President, dear.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah, no duh.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You don't want to say hi to your father?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm sure he's busy.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't you even want to ask?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Hey Joey, how `bout a cocoa, double whip cream.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Alice...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Mom, just this once, give it a rest.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're jet-lagged.  We'll talk about this back...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Back at The Fishbowl?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: We'll talk at home.  You know, most girls aren't as lucky as you.  For most girls seeing the Bolshoi ballet would be the experience of a lifetime.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know, Mom.  It was great... really.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He's in a meeting.  He can't be disturbed.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm sorry, honey.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, it's okay.  After all, he is the President, right?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: When I write my memoirs I think I'll devote an entire chapter to the cocoa aboard Air Force One.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Your father never means to be so...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I know...  But lotsa times I feel like it's me versus the world.  Some kid at school teases me and the same day a plague breaks out in Bangladesh.  I mean it doesn't take a genius to figure which is more important.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Some kids were teasing you?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's not really the point.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're right and I'll tell you a secret.  I know exactly how you feel.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Big secret.  You said the same thing to Newsweek.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yes dear?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm sorry I was so mean to you earlier.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Daddy. Daddy, please...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jim... for godsake!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I don't drink coffee.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You must be tired. It'll wake you up.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, thank you. The gunfire did that.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: You're one of Stravanavitch's men.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: So, you study world events, little one. That's good for a girl your age.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah, I study world events. Five thousand Turkienistan Muslims were slaughtered in Stravanvitch's cleansings... along with 15 American school kids. You know hQw I studied that. I went to their funerals with my dad. I met their parents.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Smart for your age, eh? Top of your class? Tell me, do you know what the word "propaganda" means?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Yeah. Do you know what the word "asshole" means.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: The woman you shot. She was my friend.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: That's the way of the world, little one. Didn't they teach you that in school?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Fuck off, you stupid asshole.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: It would be a pity to squander such a strong personality.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He didn't leave us.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You are a resilient man, Mr.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oooooh, I'm good.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Hey, you guys back already?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: How was...  ...the ballet?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It was the experience of a lifetime.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: How `bout a hug for the old man.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Alice!

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Daddy...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Daddy...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Alice... I...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: How you doing, sweetie?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Been better, Dad... You?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Oh NY god... oh my god... oh my god...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: It's okay, honey. I got you. I got you. You're okay.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: There they are!

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Okay, I'm slowing us down.

turns.speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
turns.text: The Americans say they are escorting a damaged plane. Our pilots confirm they are surrounding a 747.

turns.speaker: CERALLOS
turns.text: Did we warn them off?

turns.speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
turns.text: Yes. They refused to alter course and the 747 would not answer our hails.

turns.speaker: CERALLOS
turns.text: It's some kind of trick... a preliminary airstrike in response to our troop movement.

turns.speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
turns.text: They are in our airspace. We would be within our rights.

turns.speaker: CERALLOS
turns.text: The world would not look on us kindly if we shot down a civilian airliner.

turns.speaker: IRAQI SOLDIER
turns.text: The pilot says it is does not have the markings of a commercial jet.

turns.speaker: CERALLOS
turns.text: Warn then again. If they don't respond... shoot them down. We will not be intimidated.

turns.speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
turns.text: Do you see the maintenance panel?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
turns.text: Pop it open. There should be a red switch, toggle it up.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Okay, it's on. We've got some indicator lights here.

turns.speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
turns.text: Okay, you're aerated. To dump the fuel you have to close the circuit for the pump. There's no switch in Avionics so you'll have to cross the wires. There should be five wires, just to your left. Do you see them?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: It's cut.

turns.speaker: CHIEF MECHANIC
turns.text: cross it...  The static overwhelms the voice, then cuts out.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: U.S. Pilots, this is Air Force One.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Copy Air Force One. Welcome to the party.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Mr. President, it's an honor. Now with your permission can we lead you the fuck out of here.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You read my mind.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Put your pilot on.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: He's busy being dead.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Who's flying the fucking plane?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I'm doing what I can.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Two and three are heading toward the Boeing.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Okay. We're gonna arc a fat one to the right. Got it?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Stay cool.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: How we doing, Colonel?

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: We still got three MiGs running around and six more on the way.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Uh, we got a problem here.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Just stay on my wing, sir. I'll take you all the way in.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: No. We're losing fuel and my rudder's not responding.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Lemme take a look.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Aw, man. You're torn up pretty bad out here, sir. Do you have any elevater control.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Sluggish... I think it's jammed too.

turns.speaker: COL. CARLTON
turns.text: Uh, Tower, we got a problem up here.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: He's dead then. They must have killed him.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: We don't know that.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: Holding the president hostage is not something that slips your mind when you're making demands.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: Walter, if you have a point, make it.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: That kid's name was Jim Marshall.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: They aren't answering their hails.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: This doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: They've got no chutes. They can't control the plane, their engines are failing and they're losing fuel.

turns.speaker: DEAN
turns.text: I prefered the terrorists.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: That's game, set, and match. There's nothing to do, except call the Chief Justice.

turns.speaker: DOHERTY
turns.text: Sir, you threw out page two.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Goddamn right I did.  I asked for a tough-as-nails speech and you gave me diplomatic bullshit.  What's the point in having a speech if I have to ad-lib?

turns.speaker: DOHERTY
turns.text: It was a good ad-lib, sir.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Thanks.  Wrote it last night.

turns.speaker: DOHERTY
turns.text: Apparently taking uzis away from sixth graders isn't as popular as we thought it'd be.  Representative Taylor is working on a compromise.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Put together a score sheet.  I'll make some calls.

turns.speaker: DOHERTY
turns.text: The Iraqi ambassador is claiming it's just an exercise.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: An exercise in futility. Send the Nimitz back in.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: General Greely says it looks like the Middle East.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Does your office have anything to add, Mr. Dean?

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Can we do that?

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: We've got four hours before they make it into Turkienistan airspace.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: But they start executing hostages in

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: I hate to be pragmatic, but they'll sacrifice pawns before kings. It may take them some time to kill their way up to senior staff.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Okay. Also, I want you to put our bases in Turkey on alert, and have the Kitty Hawk prepare a retaliatory air strike.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: They still have the President, it's past their deadline and they haven't called. What do you think it means?

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: Like any good poker player, they're checking over their hand seeing which cards to play and which to discard.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: If challenged, our fighters are to state that they are on a rescue mission.

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: Iraqi's won't buy it. Either they're already in on this or they'll think we're spying.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: If fired upon, tell our fighters that they are ordered to engage.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: The Chief Justice? What on earth for?

turns.speaker: GENERAL NORTHWOOD
turns.text: To swear you in as President.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Special Agent Gibbs. You helped do this?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Yes, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Because it is my duty.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You're duty to what? The country you served doesn't exist anymore.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: My loyalty was never to my country.

turns.speaker: KC-135 PILOT
turns.text: Air Force One, this is AF-135-RA. We have been instructed to refuel your plane.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: About goddamn time.

turns.speaker: KC-135 PILOT
turns.text: Please change course to Zero Seven Four and drop to eighteen thousand feet. Over.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Air Force One, acknowledged.  tNT. EMERGENCY PARACHUTE LAUNCH RAMP.

turns.speaker: KC-135 PILOT
turns.text: Air Force One, please reduce speed to 250 knots.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: That's affirmative.

turns.speaker: KC-135 PILOT
turns.text: Ga get it.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: We've already been inspected.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Sir, this plane carries the President of the United States.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: The rest of the secret service?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Dead.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: How many others killed?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Nine.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Any of us?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Who did this?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: We checked the manifest. Everyone was accounted for.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: A secret service agent. It must be.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Remarkable aircraft. Remarkable.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: why did they do that?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Psychology. They're trying to unnerve us.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Well it worked.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Avionics compartment! It's the only place. You better get Zedeck down there fast Unless, of course, you'd rather be a martyr than a savior.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Go! Take Serge.. and watch your backs.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: We've stopped dumping... but we've only got about twenty minutes of fuel left.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: We're not going to make it.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Not even close. Hell, we can't even make Syria or Iraq.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Where are we now?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Over the Black Sea. I can probably get us to Turkey or Georgia.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: No! If we land this plane anywhere else, we will end up another Entebe.  The Americans built a super plane that flies through mushroom cloud, evades missiles and...  refuels in mid-air. Call the White House.

turns.speaker: KC-LO PILOT
turns.text: Tower, Air Force One has been boarded.

turns.speaker: TOWER
turns.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, copy One the television, graphics of the First Family against the Presidential Seal.

turns.speaker: TOWER
turns.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, do you have the President? Over.

turns.speaker: KC-LO PILOT
turns.text: Stand by.

turns.speaker: TOWER
turns.text: Romeo Tango Zulu1 this is Tower.

turns.speaker: KC-LO PILOT
turns.text: We copy. Stand by...  Tower?

turns.speaker: TOWER
turns.text: Tower, here.

turns.speaker: KC-LO PILOT
turns.text: This is Romeo Tango Zulu changing call signs.  Tower, alert air traffic, Romeo Tango Zulu is now Air Force One.  This is Air Force One... The President is safe onboard.

turns.speaker: TOWER
turns.text: Copy, Air Force One.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Ms.  Mitchell.  So nice to finally meet you in person.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: The President and I were delighted that we could accommodate you.  Now if you're all cleared?  You can follow me then.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Up on the upper deck is the cockpit and the Mission Communication Center. The MCC, as we call it, can place clear and secure phone calls to anywhere on earth.  We're linked to a network of military and civilian satellites and ground stations.  We could run the country or run a war from there if we had to.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: This is a remarkable aircraft.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: You don't know the half of it.  Did you know this entire plane is shielded from radiation?  We could fly through a mushroom cloud completely unharmed if necessary.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: A dubious distinction, no?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I guess it depends on your perspective.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: And all these rooms here?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Conference rooms, though some have other functions.  The one up front doubles as an emergency medical center.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Here's a press kit.  I'll let you guys get comfortable and once we're airborne I'll be able to schedule the interviews.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: *                     Please tell me your name.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Maria... Maria Mitchell.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: And what is it you do, Ms. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I'm responsible for Press Relations for the Flight Office.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: How are your fellow hostages feeling, Ms. Mitchell?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Scared. We're scared.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: You're pointing a gun at me.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Very good. Thank you, Ms. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Fear will keep you alive. Any one who is not afraid is bound to do something foolish, and bound to die.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What do you want with us?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Cooperation. If you try to escape, you will be met with automatic gunfire and a barricade of your comrade's bodies will prevent you from exiting. Good day.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Now, or he dies, please.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Come on, Alice.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Leave my daughter alone.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Or you will do what, Mrs. Marshall?  But I admire your courage. Your husband, on the other hand...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What do you know of my husband?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: I know he left you behind.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: My husband is a very courageous man.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Your husband is a coward. He sends soldiers half-way around the world to steal a man from his home in the middle of the night.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Do you have to be so brutal?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Why? Do you enjoy it?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: I neither enjoy nor dislike. I do what is necessary.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How can you? I mean they're people.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: But they are not ny people. You look at me as if I am a monster, but answer me this -- when your planes bombed the oil fields of Iraq, did You cry for those dark skinned men whose names you do not know and who's faces You will never see? Did You cry for their wives and children. They were people too, yes... but they were not your people.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That was war.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: So is this.  Come now, you're upsetting the little one.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Shall I begin by executing the President's daughter? She's right here.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Say something dear.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Nor will there be. My husband does not negotiate with terrorists.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You will be the first to pay for that mistake.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: The world is such a dangerous place and we can't always protect our children.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Please. You can kill me but leave my daughter alone.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Four...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Jim...

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Three...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You got what you wanted. You going to release us now?

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You're very valuable. And our nation needs so many things.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Now since we've had very little luck getting Washington or Moscow to cooperate, I wondered if you would be so kind.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Over my dead body.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: No. But since I only have a few of your staff left to kill, perhaps I will start with your family instead... Gibbs.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: She isn't a part of this. This is between you and me.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Call up Petrov and order Stravanavitch' S release.
